original_solution_mapping.L1: A pound of coffee makes 40 cups of coffee, so 3 lbs. coffee * 40 cups of coffee per lb. = <<3*40=120>>120 cups of coffee.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Angie drinks 3 cups of coffee a day, so she has enough coffee to last her 120 cups of coffee / 3 cups of coffee per day = <<120/3=40>>40 days

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 252.
    Returns: the number of days the coffee will last.
    """
    # L1
    coffee_lbs = 3 # 3 lbs. of coffee
    cups_per_lb = 40 # 40 cups of coffee
    total_cups_of_coffee = coffee_lbs * cups_per_lb

    # L2
    cups_per_day = 3 # 3 cups of coffee every day
    days_coffee_lasts = total_cups_of_coffee / cups_per_day

    # FA
    answer = days_coffee_lasts
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: A pound of coffee makes 40 cups of coffee, so {coffee_lbs} lbs. coffee * {cups_per_lb} cups of coffee per lb. = <<{coffee_lbs}*{cups_per_lb}={total_cups_of_coffee}>>{total_cups_of_coffee} cups of coffee.

Angie drinks {cups_per_day} cups of coffee a day, so she has enough coffee to last her {total_cups_of_coffee} cups of coffee / {cups_per_day} cups of coffee per day = <<{total_cups_of_coffee}/{cups_per_day}={days_coffee_lasts}>>{days_coffee_lasts} days

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: A pound of coffee makes 40 cups of coffee, so 3 lbs. coffee * 3 cups of coffee per lb. = <<3*3=9>>9 cups of coffee.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Angie drinks 3 cups of coffee a day, so she has enough coffee to last her 9 cups of coffee / 3 cups of coffee per day = <<9/3=3>>3 days

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'coffee_lbs' (3) was used instead of 'cups_per_lb' (40).
